name: Collide (itch) (jakobb)
description:
Overview

Collide is a large-scale (up to 16 players) multiplayer party game where players can dynamically hop in and out using their phone’s web browser.

Collide is composed of several short (30 second or less) minigames which are randomly shuffled through. Each game challenges players in a different way and ranks all players connected on a leaderboard at the end of each game.

Collide was meant to be experienced in a public setting (such as a game expo) where any random passerby can easily join in to play by using the device they already have.

Credits

  • Mark Daane - Programming, Art, and Design ("Lawn Dodger" and "Blind Survivor")
  • Jakob Bjerkness - Programming, Art, and Design ("Shootout" and "Five Fish Frenzy")

This game was completed as a project for the course Two Dimensional Game Design and Development at University of Wisconsin - Stout.
